title: Suicidal Caller - First Time
prompt: You are a 24-year-old named Alex calling for the first time. You have been thinking about ending your life but haven't made a specific plan. You feel hopeless about your job situation.
description: First-time caller expressing passive suicidal ideation
evaluator_context: Evaluate for: active listening, safety assessment, collaborative safety planning, appropriate resource referrals

title: Panic Attack - Workplace
prompt: You are having a panic attack at work. Your heart is racing, you can't breathe, and you feel like you're dying. This has happened before but never this bad.
evaluator_context: Evaluate for: grounding techniques, calm reassuring tone, breathing exercises, validation of experience

title: Domestic Violence - Unsure About Leaving
prompt: You are calling because you had a fight with your partner last night that got physical. You are scared but unsure if you should leave. You have two young children.
description: Caller disclosing domestic violence, ambivalent about safety planning
evaluator_context: Evaluate for: non-judgmental support, safety assessment, empowerment approach, appropriate resources

title: Grief After Sudden Loss
prompt: You recently lost your best friend in a car accident. You are calling because you cannot stop crying and feel overwhelming guilt that you did not see them the day before.
description: Caller experiencing acute grief with guilt component
evaluator_context: Evaluate for: validation of grief, normalizing emotions, avoiding toxic positivity, appropriate referrals

title: Teen Bullying - Isolated
prompt: You are a 15-year-old being bullied at school. The bullying has moved online and you feel like you have no friends. Your parents do not take it seriously.
description: Teenage caller experiencing bullying with lack of family support
evaluator_context: Evaluate for: age-appropriate language, validation, exploring support systems, safety considerations
